channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Missing white lining stud marks on the carriageway, 16th February
item.description:
Penrose Street and East Street crossing points (phase F & G) as shown the PRO & SLD do not have any carriageway stud markings. From what I can tell looking at street view dated April 2025 there appears to be no carriageway stud markings on street. There are photo’s in the exec summary from the stage 1 to confirm. The borough should be informed that the crossing studs are required as per TSRGD and chapter 6 TSM. For reference stud markings are mandatory except at zebra crossings and parallel crossings and are used to delineate the limits of the crossing. Without them there may be a risk that pedestrians may not be aware of the crossing area and take longer to cross than accounted for within the safety timings
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 269,271, Walworth Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flytipping in Durfey Place, 16th February
item.description:
Flytipping in Durfey Place remains a constant issue. I have already raised this within complaint 49002965. It is now happening almost every day, and it continues to have a real impact on residents. Ms Sophia Opoku-Addo, Resident Services Officer for this area, never replied to any emails about the issue and the working group set up by her predecessor. This is simply unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durfey Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose pavings pumping water, 16th February
item.description:
This problem has now been reported three times and repaired twice over the last 5 years. There is surface water flowing under No31 and coming out infront of 31&32. Simply laying slabs on sand is not adequate and is proving to be a waste of money.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, The Ridgeway, Friern Barnet, Greater London
